Basic details: Michael Johnson, a 45-year-old male, comes to the outpatient clinic complaining of bloody urine.
Vitals:
BP: 130/80 mm Hg
Temp: 99.1°F (37.3°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 78/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit upright in the chair and appear slightly anxious.
Frequently ask to use the restroom.
If urinalysis is mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What will that test show?”
Challenging question: “Is this blood in my urine a sign of cancer?”
